Detailed Description

template<bool t_bManaged>
class WTL::CPenT< t_bManaged >

Wraps a GDI pen.

This class encapsulates a Windows graphics device interface (GDI) pen.

Definition at line 68 of file atlgdi.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

template<bool t_bManaged>
WTL::CPenT< t_bManaged >::CPenT (  HPEN    hPen = NULL )  [inline]
 

Constructor.

This constructor creates an instance of a CPenT object. After constructing it, you should initialize it by using either the CreatePen or CreatePenIndirect methods, or by calling CreateStockObject. You can also supply a valid pen handle as input argument.

Parameters:
hPen  A pen handle.

Definition at line 75 of file atlgdi.h.

References WTL::CPenT< t_bManaged >::m_hPen.

template<bool t_bManaged>
WTL::CPenT< t_bManaged >::~CPenT (    )  [inline]
 

Destructor.

If the instance is of CPen type, then the pen is destroyed. If the instance is of CPenHandle type, the nothing is done.

Definition at line 78 of file atlgdi.h.

References WTL::CPenT< t_bManaged >::DeleteObject(), and WTL::CPenT< t_bManaged >::m_hPen.

Definition at line 90 of file atlgdi.h.

References WTL::CPenT< t_bManaged >::m_hPen.

template<bool t_bManaged>
HPEN WTL::CPenT< t_bManaged >::CreatePen (  int    nPenStyle,
int    nWidth,
const LOGBRUSH *    pLogBrush,
int    nStyleCount = 0,
const DWORD *    lpStyle = NULL
)  [inline]
 

Creates a pen.

This method initializes a pen with the specified style, width, and color. The pen can be subsequently selected as the current pen for any device context.

Parameters:
nPenStyle  Specifies the style for the pen.
nWidth  Specifies the width of the pen.
pLogBrush  Specifies a brush
nStyleCount  Specifies a style.
lpStyle  An array of pen styles.
Returns:
The handle of the new pen. It returns NULL is no pen was created.

Definition at line 114 of file atlgdi.h.

References WTL::CPenT< t_bManaged >::m_hPen.

template<bool t_bManaged>
HPEN WTL::CPenT< t_bManaged >::CreatePen (  int    nPenStyle,
int    nWidth,
COLORREF    crColor
)  [inline]
 

Create a pen.

This method initializes a pen with the specified style, width, and color. The pen can be subsequently selected as the current pen for any device context.

Parameters:
nPenStyle  Specifies the style for the pen.
nWidth  Specifies the width of the pen.
crColor  Contains an RGB color for the pen.
Returns:
The handle of the new pen. It returns NULL is no pen was created.

template<bool t_bManaged>
bool WTL::CPenT< t_bManaged >::GetExtLogPen (  EXTLOGPEN &    ExtLogPen )  const [inline]
 

Returns the EXTLOGPEN structure.

This method gets a EXTLOGPEN underlying structure. The EXTLOGPEN structure defines the style, color, and pattern of a pen.

For example, call GetExtLogPen to match the particular style of pen.

Parameters:
ExtLogPen  Points to a EXTLOGPEN structure to contain information about the pen.
Returns:
Nonzero if it is successful; otherwise, it is zero.

template<bool t_bManaged>
WTL::CPenT< t_bManaged >::operator HPEN (    )  const [inline]
 

Returns the pen handle.

This casting operator gets the attached Windows GDI handle to the CPenT object. This operator supports direct use of an HPEN object.
